WorkItem.ClosedComment: The 'Operator' formatting color correctly changes the color of operators in VS 2012. VS 2010 is unsupported.
WorkItem.Description:
I've installed TypeScript for VS 2010 using the method described [here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14510511/how-can-i-install-typescript-with-visual-studio-2010-and-vista). I use a dark theme while programming (easier on the eyes) and although I can change the syntax colors for every type of element, I can't find the setting that controls the colors of operators. Currently they are a default "green blue", and there is no such setting in my VS Fonts and Colors panel. __You need to honor the Script Operator color instead of using the green-blue color.__

![Image](http://i.stack.imgur.com/UcJsu.png)
This is what it currently looks like.

Just FYI, the settings that control typescript element colors are (under Fonts and Colors):

* Script Comment
* Script Function Block Start
* Script Identifier
* Script Keyword
* Script Number
* Script Operator
* Script String
WorkItem.Summary: Cannot change colors of operators in TypeScript in VS 2010
